results.content:
Summary: Teacher knows what he is doing, and you can learn a lot from what he is doing. But, he does not really explain why he is doing what he is doing. 
The lectures themselves definitely need to be better, especially the 'more in depth' ones. Let me mention that it good and very helpfull to watch someone who codes and who kinda knows what he is doing. But, I can go to my fellow more experienced programmer on work and just watch him code, for free. In a bought course I expect lectures which learn a certain point/skill/theorem and at the same time that the teacher does not wanders away from this main subject to much. This is what is generally missing in your lectures - for at least the lectures I've watched.

Summary: Teacher knows what he is doing, and you can learn a lot from what he is doing. But, he does not really explain why he is doing what he is doing.
The lectures themselves definitely need to be better, especially the 'more in depth' ones. Let me mention that it good and very helpfull to watch someone who codes and who kinda knows what he is doing. But, I can go to my fellow more experienced programmer on work and just watch him code, for free. In a bought course I expect lectures which learn a certain point/skill/theorem and at the same time that the teacher does not wanders away from this main subject to much. This is what is generally missing in your lectures - for at least the lectures I've watched.
